sources.title: "Is Money Everything?" (1923)
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation   "Is Money Everything?" is a drama, included in our program to illustrate the work and contributions of our star Martha Mansfield. Martha Mansfield plays an excellent role as the unhappily married temptress looking for love.   Directed by                     Glen Lyons Produced by                   D.M. Film Corporation Written by                      Glen Lyons Starring                          Norman Kerry, Martha Mansfield, Miriam Cooper Cinematography            Alvin Knechtel Distributed by                Vital Exchanges, Inc. Release date                    February 1, 1923 Running time                 59 minutes Country                           United States Language                         Silent film, English intertitles.   Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational or personal use tips the balance in favor of fair use."

metadata.Plot: A farmer, unhappy with his life, decides to go the city to try and make his fortune. He takes a friend along with him. The two of them become successful, but that success brings other, unforeseen problems into their lives.
metadata.Actors: Norman Kerry, Miriam Cooper, Andrew Hicks
